connector.description: Upload, download and manage files, folders, groups, collaborations, etc on Dropbox.

camel.source.path.operation.name: camel.source.path.operation
camel.source.path.operation.description: The specific action (typically is a CRUD action) to perform on Dropbox remote folder. One of: [put] [del] [search] [get] [move]

camel.source.endpoint.accessToken.name: camel.source.endpoint.accessToken
camel.source.endpoint.accessToken.description: The access token to make API requests for a specific Dropbox user

camel.source.endpoint.client.name: camel.source.endpoint.client
camel.source.endpoint.client.description: To use an existing DbxClient instance as DropBox client.

camel.source.endpoint.clientIdentifier.name: camel.source.endpoint.clientIdentifier
camel.source.endpoint.clientIdentifier.description: Name of the app registered to make API requests

camel.source.endpoint.localPath.name: camel.source.endpoint.localPath
camel.source.endpoint.localPath.description: Optional folder or file to upload on Dropbox from the local filesystem. If this option has not been configured then the message body is used as the content to upload.

camel.source.endpoint.query.name: camel.source.endpoint.query
camel.source.endpoint.query.description: A space-separated list of sub-strings to search for. A file matches only if it contains all the sub-strings. If this option is not set, all files will be matched.

camel.source.endpoint.remotePath.name: camel.source.endpoint.remotePath
camel.source.endpoint.remotePath.description: Original file or folder to move

camel.source.endpoint.uploadMode.name: camel.source.endpoint.uploadMode
camel.source.endpoint.uploadMode.description: Which mode to upload. in case of add the new file will be renamed if a file with the same name already exists on dropbox. in case of force if a file with the same name already exists on dropbox, this will be overwritten. One of: [add] [force]

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.component.dropbox.bridgeErrorHandl.name: camel.component.dropbox.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.dropbox.bridgeErrorHandl.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.dropbox.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.dropbox.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.dropbox.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
